```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper permissions on pre-commit hook
    analysis: |
      The setup.sh script copies the pre-commit hook file from admin/pre-commit into the .git/hooks directory and makes it executable with chmod +x. However, it does not restrict the permissions on this file.

      Pre-commit hooks can be used to execute arbitrary code before a git commit is made. Since any user who can write to this repository can modify the pre-commit file, they could add malicious code that will get executed anytime a commit is performed.

      To exploit this, an attacker with write access could modify the pre-commit hook to add malicious code, steal secrets, or otherwise compromise the build system and any system the code is deployed on when other developers make commits.
    cwe: CWE-732
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - admin/setup.sh
    classification: very promising

```

leads.headline: Improper permissions on pre-commit hook
leads.analysis:
The setup.sh script copies the pre-commit hook file from admin/pre-commit into the .git/hooks directory and makes it executable with chmod +x. However, it does not restrict the permissions on this file.

Pre-commit hooks can be used to execute arbitrary code before a git commit is made. Since any user who can write to this repository can modify the pre-commit file, they could add malicious code that will get executed anytime a commit is performed.

To exploit this, an attacker with write access could modify the pre-commit hook to add malicious code, steal secrets, or otherwise compromise the build system and any system the code is deployed on when other developers make commits.
